page.title: 16TOURISM
page.content: Westwell:- Cyclists & Walkers pass through to Canterbury,sometimes stopping at the Wheel Inn or staying overnight with local people.The Pilgrims Way passes within the parish. Hothfield:- The Common,famous nationally for its plants, is a great attraction for expert & inexpert nature lovers. A picnic area attached to the common is much used by regular passers by & tourists. Most tourists are only in transit. Cycling groups & car rally clubs use Hothfield as a stop en route or the plaque on the Old School House as a rally clue.
